Title: Resistive switching in oxides
Abstract: © Springer International Publishing Switzerland 2015.Resistive switching in oxides, the phenomenon whereby the resistance of samples of the matrix can be cycled between states with contrasts of up to several orders of magnitude, has received growing attention over the past decade thanks to the possibility of exploiting this effect in novel memory technologies. Here we summarise the current state of the art in the field, paying particular attention to the underlying mechanisms of switching, which involves the creation of defects in the oxide. We also describe potential technological applications.
